name: Request
comment: An HTTP request where the entire request body is known in advance.

method.name: method
method.comment: The HTTP method of the request. Most commonly "GET" or "POST", less commonly "HEAD", "PUT", or "DELETE". Non-standard method names are also supported.

url.name: url
url.comment: The URL to which the request will be sent.

body.name: body
body.comment:
The body of the request as a string. This is converted to and from http/http.Request.bodyBytes using http/http.Request.encoding.

When this is set, if the request does not yet have a Content-Type header, one will be added with the type text/plain. Then the charset parameter of the Content-Type header (whether new or pre-existing) will be set to http/http.Request.encoding if it wasn't already set.

bodyBytes.name: bodyBytes
bodyBytes.comment:
The bytes comprising the body of the request. This is converted to and from http/http.Request.body using http/http.Request.encoding.

This list should only be set, not be modified in place.

bodyFields.name: bodyFields
bodyFields.comment:
The form-encoded fields in the body of the request as a map from field names to values. The form-encoded body is converted to and from http/http.Request.bodyBytes using http/http.Request.encoding (in the same way as http/http.Request.body).

If the request doesn't have a Content-Type header of application/x-www-form-urlencoded, reading this will throw a dart-core.StateError.

If the request has a Content-Type header with a type other than application/x-www-form-urlencoded, setting this will throw a dart-core.StateError. Otherwise, the content type will be set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

This map should only be set, not modified in place.

contentLength.name: contentLength
contentLength.comment:
The size of the request body, in bytes. This is calculated from http/http.Request.bodyBytes.

The content length cannot be set for http/http.Request, since it's automatically calculated from http/http.Request.bodyBytes.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.comment:
The encoding used for the request. This encoding is used when converting between http/http.Request.bodyBytes and http/http.Request.body.

If the request has a Content-Type header and that header has a charset parameter, that parameter's value is used as the encoding. Otherwise, if http/http.Request.encoding has been set manually, that encoding is used. If that hasn't been set either, this defaults to http/dart-convert.UTF8.

If the charset parameter's value is not a known http/dart-convert.Encoding, reading this will throw a dart-core.FormatException.

If the request has a Content-Type header, setting this will set the charset parameter on that header.

finalize.name: finalize
finalize.comment: Freezes all mutable fields and returns a single-subscription http/http.ByteStream containing the request body.

contentLength.name: contentLength
contentLength.comment: The size of the request body, in bytes. This defaults to -1, which indicates that the size of the request is not known in advance.

followRedirects.name: followRedirects
followRedirects.comment: Whether the client should follow redirects while resolving this request. Defaults to true.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides http/http.Request.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

maxRedirects.name: maxRedirects
maxRedirects.comment: The maximum number of redirects to follow when http/http.Request.followRedirects is true. If this number is exceeded the BaseResponse future will signal a http/dart-io.RedirectException. Defaults to 5.

persistentConnection.name: persistentConnection
persistentConnection.comment: Whether a persistent connection should be maintained with the server. Defaults to true.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and http/http.Request.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the http/http.Request.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

finalize.name: finalize
finalize.comment:
Finalizes the HTTP request in preparation for it being sent. This freezes all mutable fields and returns a single-subscription http/http.ByteStream that emits the body of the request.

The base implementation of this returns null rather than a http/http.ByteStream; subclasses are responsible for creating the return value, which should be single-subscription to ensure that no data is dropped. They should also freeze any additional mutable fields they add that don't make sense to change after the request headers are sent.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
http/http.Request.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to http/http.Request.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If http/http.Request.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of http/http.Request.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

send.name: send
send.comment:
Sends this request.

This automatically initializes a new http/http.Client and closes that client once the request is complete. If you're planning on making multiple requests to the same server, you should use a single http/http.Client for all of those requests.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
